expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the plush shell by squeezing a section of the white rim so the large padded mass hangs outward. The soft, substantial volume provides pronounced inertia that lags at swing start and follows through heavily, giving a cushioned but convincing sensation of a weighted axe head.
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Place the controller flat on a desk with the buttons facing upward. Swing the plush shell straight down onto the hard plastic top shell. The rigid housing delivers a crisp stop on first contact. As the plush compresses further, the thumb-sticks and triggers depress slightly, adding a brief springy "tension" that is released when the plush rebounds, imitating the moment the log fibers finally give way.
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The user feels sharp initial impact as the axe strikes wood. Tension increases until a sudden satisfying release occurs - the wood cracks and splits completely.
expressivity.explanation: The rigid plastic gives a sharp impact and the slight trigger depression adds a notable tension and release, closely matching the chop-and-split feel.
